data.title: For The Record: Remembering Ann Arbor's Lost Music Stores - A Zine for Record Store Day 2024
data.text:
As part of Ann Arbor 200, this zine was created for Record Store Day 2024 to commemorate music and record stores from Ann Arbor's past. Materials used in the zine are listed below. Find out more about Ann Arbor's record and music stores in AADL's archival collections.

Front Cover

Record Listening Station in New Ann Arbor Public Library - Ann Arbor News, March 1958

“Hurrah for Ann Arbor!” / Music Stores

Background:“Hurrah for Ann Arbor!” sheet music - “Carmina collegensia; a complete collection of the songs of the American colleges,” 1868

Schaeberle Music Store ad - Ann Arbor Courier, June 30, 1897

Ann Arbor Organ Works ad - 1883-1884 Washtenaw County Directory, page 19

Alvin Wilsey ad - 1883-1884 Washtenaw County Directory, page 145

The Graphophone, Ann Arbor Music Co. ad - Ann Arbor Argus-Democrat, January 13, 1899

F. M. Root ad - 1901 Glen V. Mills Ann Arbor and Ypsilanti City Directory, page 240

Latest County News - Ann Arbor Register, May 7, 1896

Grinnell Brothers

Background: Marchese Building on South Main St - Ann Arbor News, 1941

Title: Grinnell Bros. Music House ad - 1954 Polk's Ann Arbor City Directory, Classified Section, page 58

Learn to Play the Accordion ad - Ann Arbor News, November 10, 1950

Grinnell Bros. Music House “For pleasure or profession…” - 1960 Polk's Ann Arbor City Directory, Yellow Pages, page 56
